subject: Travel
title: Jet Engines: How They Work
description: A quick, practical guide to Jet Engines: How They Work.

hook.text: A jet engine works by sucking in air, squeezing it, heating it, and blasting it out the back.

buildup.text: Frank Whittle patented the jet engine in 1930. The British military ignored him for nearly a decade.

discovery.text: Germany flew the first jet aircraft in 1939. Britain rushed to catch up and tested theirs in 1941.

twist.text: Whittle's engine arrived too late for World War II. Germany's jets flew combat missions first.

climax.text: After the war, jet engines transformed aviation. Every modern airliner uses Whittle's basic design.

punchline.text: The military ignored him. His engine powers every flight today.
